comments.body: I think we can move this line to function `commonHeaderNodes`, where the method `setUIRoot` is called.

At first, I considered the way you mention but to do so, we need to have an additional parameter in `commonHeaderNodes` to pass `activeTab` only for this purpose.
Which do you think is better?
I see. Let's keep it this way. The method `basicSparkPage` also calls the function `commonHeaderNodes` but there is no `activeTab` in it.
FYI: this is move from `org.apache.spark.streaming.ui.UIUtils` with no change

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +144,148 @@   * @param timezone only for test
   */
  def formatBatchTime(
      batchTime: Long,
      batchInterval: Long,

comments.body:
@gengliangwang the other arguments like headers, headerClasses are Seqs. Why make this one a Map?
I think having Nones there makes it more explicit that it has to have the same length that the other Seqs. Otherwise it's easy to miss an error when adding a new column that all indices in the Map shift.
It is the same case as headerClasses, I have done it as the same way to be homogeneous

I see. My concern was the length of `tooltipHeaders` can be different with `headers`. Passing parameter `Seq[Option[String]]` seems equivalent to `Map[Int, String]`.
I am fine with either way.

Could you add an assertion that if tooltipHeaders are nonEmpty, it is a sequence of the same length as headers? Otherwise, it's easy to add a new column and forget to add/shift the tooltips, and it can go unnoticed, as it's UI and has no automated test.
(same can be done for headerClasses I guess)

Hi @srowen. 
We have put this validation at the thriftServers pages code because we don't want to break  the homogeneous way of treating the parameters at UIUtils.listingTable. headerClasses has no requiere to be the same lenght as headers param so I thought it could be better to do at the same way with the new param and include the validation outside.
